eu.slipo.athenarc.triplegeo.utils

Class Assistant

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.slipo.athenarc.triplegeo.utils.Assistant

  • public class Assistant
extends java.lang.Object
    Assistance class with various helper methods used in transformation or reverse transformation.
    Version:
    1.7
    Author:
    Kostas Patroumpas

      • notifyProgress

        public void notifyProgress(int numRec,
                           int partition_index)
        Notifies the user about progress in parsing input records. This method is used when running over Spark/GeoSpark.
        Parameters:
        numRec - The number of records processed so far.
        partition_index - The index of the partition.

      • reportStatistics

        public void reportStatistics(long dt,
                             int numRec,
                             int numTriples,
                             java.lang.String serialization,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> attrStatistics,
                             java.lang.String mode,
                             java.lang.String targetSRID,
                             java.lang.String outputFile,
                             int partition_index)
        Report statistics upon termination of the transformation process.
        Parameters:
        dt - The clock time (in milliseconds) elapsed since the start of transformation process.
        numRec - The total number of records that have been processed.
        numTriples - The number of RDF triples resulted from transformation.
        serialization - A string with the user-specified serialization of output triples.
        attrStatistics - Statistics collected per attribute during transformation.
        mode - Transformation mode, as specified in the configuration.
        targetSRID - Output spatial reference system (CRS).
        outputFile - Path to the output file containing the RDF triples.
        partition_index - The identifier (index) of the partition in case of Spark execution.

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        g - Input geometry $param geomOntology RDF ontology used in geometry representations (GeoSPARQL, Virtuoso geometry RDF, or WGS84 Geoposition RDF vocabulary)
        Returns:
        WKT of the geometry

      • getArea

        public double getArea(java.lang.String polygonWKT)
        Returns the area of a polygon geometry from its the Well-Known Text representation.
        Parameters:
        polygonWKT - WKT of the polygon
        Returns:
        calculated area (in the same units as the CRS of the geometry)

      • getArea

        public double getArea(java.lang.String polygonWKT,
                      int targetSRID)
        Built-in function that returns the area of a polygon geometry from its the Well-Known Text representation.
        Parameters:
        polygonWKT - WKT of the polygon
        targetSRID - EPSG code of the coordinate reference system (CRS) of the geometry
        Returns:
        calculated area in square meters (NOT in the units of the CRS of the geometry)

      • getLength

        public double getLength(java.lang.String wkt)
        Returns the length of a linestring or the perimeter of a polygon geometry from its the Well-Known Text representation.
        Parameters:
        wkt - WKT of the linestring or polygon
        Returns:
        calculated length/perimeter (in the same units as the CRS of the geometry)

      • getLength

        public double getLength(java.lang.String wkt,
                        int targetSRID)
        Built-in function that returns the length of a linestring or the perimeter of a polygon geometry from its the Well-Known Text representation.
        Parameters:
        wkt - WKT of the linestring or polygon
        targetSRID - EPSG code of the coordinate reference system (CRS) of the geometry
        Returns:
        calculated length/perimeter in square meters (NOT in the units of the CRS of the geometry)

        public double[] getLonLatCoords(java.lang.String wkt,
                                int targetSRID)
        Built-in function that returns a pair of lon/lat coordinates (in WGS84) of a geometry as calculated from its the Well-Known Text representation.
        Parameters:
        wkt - WKT of the geometry
        targetSRID - the EPSG code of the CRS of this geometry
        Returns:
        An array with the pair of lon/lat coordinates

      • getTransliteration

        public java.lang.String getTransliteration(java.lang.String val)
        Built-in function that provides a transliteration into phonetically equivalent Latin characters of a string literal written in a non-Latin alphabet.
        Parameters:
        val - The original string literal (may contain Latin characters).
        Returns:
        The transliterated sting.

      • standardizePhoneNumber

        public java.lang.String standardizePhoneNumber(java.lang.String phone,
                                               java.lang.String country_code)
        Built-in function that brings phone numbers into a consistent format.
        Parameters:
        phone - The original string literal representing a phone number
        country_code - The international country code of this phone number (e.g., 49 for Germany, 30 for Greece, etc.)
        Returns:
        The formatted phone number, stripped from non-numeric characters.

      • getNextSerial

        public long getNextSerial()
        Provides the next serial number (long) to be used as an intermediate identifier
        Returns:
        A long number.

      • getUUID

        public java.lang.String getUUID(java.lang.String featureSource,
                                java.lang.String id)
        Built-in function that provides a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents a 128-bit long value to be used in the URI of a transformed feature. Also known as GUID (Globally Unique Identifier).
        Parameters:
        featureSource - The name of the feature source, to be used as suffix of the identifier.
        id - A unique identifier of the feature.
        Returns:
        The auto-generated UUID based on the concatenation of the feature source and the identifier.

      • getUUID

        public java.lang.String getUUID(java.lang.String id)
        Built-in function that provides a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents a 128-bit long value to be used in the URI of a transformed feature. This UUID is generated by hashing over the original identifier. Also known as GUID (Globally Unique Identifier).
        Parameters:
        id - A unique identifier of the feature.
        Returns:
        The auto-generated UUID.

      • getRandomUUID

        public java.lang.String getRandomUUID()
        Built-in function that provides a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents a 128-bit long value to be used in the URI of a transformed feature. This is a secure random UUID with minimal chance of collisions with existing ones. Also known as GUID (Globally Unique Identifier).
        Returns:
        The auto-generated UUID.

      • keepOriginalID

        public java.lang.String keepOriginalID(java.lang.String id)
        Build-in function that retains the original identifier of a feature in the resulting URI or the transformed resource.
        Parameters:
        id - A unique identifier of the feature.
        Returns:
        The identifier to be used for the transformed resource.

      • encodeUTF

        public java.lang.String encodeUTF(java.lang.String s,
                                  java.lang.String encoding)
        Provides a UTF-8 encoding of the given string originally represented in the given encoding
        Parameters:
        s - input string value
        encoding - name of the character encoding
        Returns:
        output encoded string

      • isValidISOLanguage

        public boolean isValidISOLanguage(java.lang.String s)
        Checks if the given string represents a valid ISO 639-1 language code (2 digits)
        Parameters:
        s - An input string value
        Returns:
        True is this is a valid ISO 639-1 language code; otherwise, False.

      • getLanguage

        public java.lang.String getLanguage(java.lang.String attr,
                                    int i)
        Built-in function that extracts the language tag from an attribute name. This tag will be attached to all values obtained for this attribute. ASSUMPTION: The tag is composed from the suffix after the i-th character in the attribute name.
        Parameters:
        attr - The attribute name.
        i - Index of the i-th character in the attribute name.
        Returns:
        The language tag to be applied in string literals created for values from this attribute.

      • getDataSource

        public java.lang.String getDataSource()
        Built-in function that identifies the provider of the dataset as specified in the configuration settings.
        Returns:
        The name of the data provider.

      • concatenate

        public java.lang.String concatenate(java.lang.String val1,
                                    java.lang.String val2)
        Built-in function that concatenates a pair of string values into a new one.
        Parameters:
        val1 - The first value.
        val2 - The second value.
        Returns:
        The concatenated value.

      • concatenate

        public java.lang.String concatenate(java.lang.String[] values)
        Built-in function that concatenates an array of multiple string values into a unified one.
        Parameters:
        values - The array of string values.
        Returns:
        The concatenated value.

      • applyRuntimeMethod

        public java.lang.Object applyRuntimeMethod(java.lang.String methodName,
                                           java.lang.Object[] args)
        Applies a function at runtime, based on user-defined YML specifications regarding an attribute. This is carried out thanks to the Java Reflection API.
        Parameters:
        methodName - The name of the method to invoke (e.g., getLanguage).
        args - The necessary arguments for the method to run (may be multiple).
        Returns:
        A string value resulting from the invocation (e.g., language tag extracted from the attribute name).

      • check_ShapefileFolder

        public boolean check_ShapefileFolder(java.lang.String inputFolder)
        Checks if the the input is correct. The input must be a directory that contains all the necessary shapefiles.
        Parameters:
        inputFolder - the path to the input folder.
        Returns:
        true or false if the input is correct.

      • check_ShapeFiles

        private boolean check_ShapeFiles(java.lang.String inputFolder)
        Checks if folder contains the necessary files of Shapefile. The files must have the same name with the folder.
        Parameters:
        inputFolder - the path to the input folder.
        Returns:
        true or false if the folder contains the necessary files.

      • get_ShapeFile

        public java.lang.String get_ShapeFile(java.lang.String extension,
                                      java.lang.String inputFolder)
        Returns the absolute path of the requested file.
        Parameters:
        extension: - the extension of the file that will search for.
        inputFolder - the path to the input folder.
        Returns:
        the absolute path of the requested file
